official_title: A bill to provide for a study by the Secretary of Transportation, in consultation with the Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of the Treasury, concerning measures necessary to ensure the security of firearms, ammunition, and explosives being transported in interstate commerce.

summary.text: Arms Transportation Security Act of 1981 - Directs the Secretary of Transportation, in consultation with the Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of the Treasury, to conduct a study of: (1) the prevalent causes of losses of firearms, ammunition, and explosives (including the components thereof) being transported in interstate commerce by private persons or government agencies; (2) the standards of security necessary to provide adequate protection from losses of such items; and (3) the appropriate measures necessary to achieve such standards. Directs the Secretary to report to the President and Congress within one year regarding the results of such study.
